comments.creator: matias0184@live.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 563644
bug.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

im was watching one video in hd (720) in youtube 


Actual results:

the image was duplicated and static, and below the video continued.
im was testing this bug and it is recurred, also when i activated hardware aceleleration in google chrome. In both cases, i have updated flash player (10.3), i use windows 7 64 bits, intel core i5 (2010 proccessors with intel hd graphics- drivers updated- all updated, firefox 7.0)


Expected results:

normal reproduction of the video, the bug isnt ocurred in internet explorer, safari and opera browser.

You got the same thing in Firefox and in google chrome ?
What makes you then believe that this is a browser bug and not a graphic card driver one ?
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
You got the same thing in Firefox and in google chrome ?
What makes you then believe that this is a browser bug and not a graphic card driver one ?
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de

comments.text:
because in internet explorer, opera and safari i havent this problem,

thank you for your helping



(In reply to Matthias Versen (Matti) from comment #1)
> You got the same thing in Firefox and in google chrome ?
> What makes you then believe that this is a browser bug and not a graphic
> card driver one ?
comments.author: matias0184@live.com
comments.creator: matias0184@live.com
comments.raw_text:
because in internet explorer, opera and safari i havent this problem,

thank you for your helping



(In reply to Matthias Versen (Matti) from comment #1)
> You got the same thing in Firefox and in google chrome ?
> What makes you then believe that this is a browser bug and not a graphic
> card driver one ?

There is no hardware acceleration in Opera and depending in the version in Safari and IE.

Does it go away if you disable the hardware acceleration in Firefox 
(tools/options/advanced/general + FF restart) ?
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
There is no hardware acceleration in Opera and depending in the version in Safari and IE.

Does it go away if you disable the hardware acceleration in Firefox 
(tools/options/advanced/general + FF restart) ?
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
matias0184@live.com
comments.raw_text:
yes, i disable hardware acceleration and the problem persists.
(i test internet explorer with last version9, with hardware acc. activated. Safari with hardw. acc. also. Opera doesnt have i think)
comments.author: matias0184@live.com
comments.text:
yes, i disable hardware acceleration and the problem persists.
(i test internet explorer with last version9, with hardware acc. activated. Safari with hardw. acc. also. Opera doesnt have i think)
